summary: This is an internal FBI email from July 2, 2019, sent shortly after Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York. It outlines immediate operational plans for his arrest upon return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, and interviews with co-conspirators and individuals in Florida.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: The author of the email, directing FBI Squad C-20 on operational planning for Epstein's arrest and related investigative actions.

connections.description: The SSA is leading the FBI squad planning the arrest and investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was issued.

events.title: Operational Planning for Arrest
events.description: FBI Squad C-20 is placed on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, and interview co-conspirators.

events.title: Deployment to Florida
events.description: Plans are made to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.

locations: NYC (New York City, presumably Epstein's residence)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The FBI also planned to deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview 1-3 individuals there.
The email indicates the investigation and arrest efforts were to be led by FBI Squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) in New York.
